"Do to circumstances outside of our control, including a low pressure system in the sales of PC's, we are today making a prudent sales track modification. We are taking all measures possible to minimize the effects of this disaster, including suspending all dividend service until further notice."

Topic.Title: Google Nexus 10 won't be released until 1H 2013

Message.Msg: I agree it is good for Nvidia as it will enable them to sell many more Nexus 7 with Tegra 3 chips. However, Nvidia sometimes talk about that their roadmap is a convincing and sometimes partly deciding factor for their customers when engaging with Nvidia. So perhaps this also means that Google has seen the light regarding "Tegra 4" and has decided it is worth waiting for (otherwise their Nexus 10 could be rendered obsolete when competitors in 1H 2013 release T4 tablets). Just my thoughts. Have a nice day all. I am so looking forward to the next CC.

Message.Title: NVDA SHORT INTEREST 13,979,797
Message.Msg: short sellers are NOT investors

Message.Title: Sheared by the Shorts: How Short Sellers Fleece Investors by Ellen Brown Civil litigation attorney; author, 'Web of Debt'
Message.Msg: A bear raid is the practice of targeting a stock or other asset for take-down, either for quick profits or for corporate takeover. Today the target is commodities, but tomorrow it could be something else. When Lehman Brothers went bankrupt in September 2008, some analysts thought the investment firm's condition was no worse than its competitors. What brought it down was a massive bear raid on 9-11 of that year, when its stock price dropped by 41 percent.

Topic.Title: Sheared by the Shorts: How Short Sellers Fleece Investors by Ellen Brown Civil litigation attorney; author, 'Web of Debt'

Topic.Title: Titan supercomputer, powered by NVIDIA GPUs, debuts for open scientific research

Message.Msg: "It's almost mindboggling how fast Titan operates. The system is capable of churning through more than 20,000 trillion calculations each second -- or 20 petaflops.. The system, developed by Cray, contains 18,688 nodes, with each containing a 16-core AMD Opteron processor..."

Topic.Title: Titan supercomputer, powered by NVIDIA GPUs, debuts for open scientific research

Message.Msg: So Best? Those 18,688 AMD Opteron processors -- each with 16 cores each, they do all the super computing stuff, right? And the little nvidia graphic processing units light-up the control room displays. So folks can see how those 18,688 AMD Opteron processors are running.

Topic.Title: what are we missing? investor confidence is so low

Message.Msg: its hard to look forward and not think mobile is the place to be...people would rather not eat than not have their cell phones and tablets. I think nvidia made the right decision to go hard at the mobile market but they need to execute more rapidly and secure some large design wins for it to be profitable. Hopefully wayne will have massive design wins in the coming year when its announced early next year. You would think that even without mobile, the 28nm kepler line should be sellling really well considering they were selling every chip they could get their hands on as of a few months ago. It should take a whole quarter just to fill the channel sufficiently so guidance should be good. At 12, the stock has nothing priced into it at all. I suspect that after several quarters, the management will finally yield to the questions about what they are doing with all that cash and institue a potential buyback program to reduce liquidity. They need to do something for the shareholders otherwise more will leave and the price will continue to decline.

Topic.Title: Hello Wayne! nVidia Tegra 4 set to launch at 2013 CES in early Janaury

Message.Msg: you are funny.... Snapdragon S4 Pro already in devices as of a whole month ago. With LTE integrated no less. Samsung's Exynos 5xxx. Wayne announcement in jan 2013 = device out dec 2013, that's almost 15 months behind the S4 Pro. No doubt well before then, aapl would have switched to their own quad A15s too. Nvda is so late, might as well go battle txn for Amzn's jelly bean sockets. Now if nvda had been able to keep to their schedule of 1 chip/year and announced Wayne last Jan, it would have been a different matter. The whole Tegra program is dead because nvda is missing out on the whole A15 generation.

Topic.Title: Wayne Tegra 4 is based on quad-core A15 plus ninja core (4+1) whereas competitions have dual-core only

Message.Msg: "Or nvda just lacks CPU competence?" NVidia did buy Stexar, which was formed by former INtel employees... I've listened to Bill Daly talks and he definitely knows his stuff... NVidia did have its chipset group, which appears that NVidia is integrating the CPU and chipset into something called Tegra... And NVidia is integrating proven CPU cores... Tegra is simpler than their high-end GPUs... Guessing that the delay has been due to integrating Kepler cores into Tegra... Snapdragon GPUs are way behind NVidia's...

Topic.Title: 3G Nexus 7, Nexus 4, Nexus 10 to be available on November 13; Nexus 7 32GB is available now in US

Message.Msg: Speaking of Google launches, did you see that nvidia lost All Three new devices? Sad, but true. 1. The new $99 Nexus 7 tablet -- Google selected a China-based WonderMedia Technologies PRIZM WM8950 single-core 800 MHz Cortex-A9 CPU with Mali-400 Graphics Processing Unit. 'Cuda been Huge volume win for nvidia. 2. The new co-branded Samsung Nexus 10 tablet -- Will use a self-manufactured Samsung Exynos 5 processor. Why buy 'em when you can make better yourself, right? 3. The new LG Nexus 4 smartphone -- Nope not a Tegra. The LG Nexus 4 will be powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon quad-core 1.5 GHz processor. It's likely some higher-end models will have Qualcomm's integrated 4G LTE processors too. 0 for 3, boys. And more hopes, well, d-a-s-h-e-d.
